main

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    A Board Class containing an 8x8 grid on which checkers can be played.

    Each square is a member of a 2-dimensional Piece array that can hold a single instance of a 'Piece' class.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Board getInstance()

      • initializeBoard

        public void initializeBoard()
        Initializes the game board by creating an integer array to store the information of every square on the board. Each square will contain a 0 for empty space, a 1 if it holds a piece for player 1 or a 2 if it holds a piece for player 2.

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()

      • checkSquare

        public Piece checkSquare(Location square)
        Checks the board array to identify the Piece object occupying a given square.
        Parameters:
        square - the Location on the board to be checked.
        Returns:
        boardArray[x][y] The Piece object held on that particular Board coordinates- null if empty.

      • getPieces

        public Piece[] getPieces(Colour aColour)
        Acessor Method to find all of the Pieces of a given Colour and return them in an Array.
        Parameters:
        aColour - The colour of the Pieces to be searched for.
        Returns:
        An array containing all of the Pieces of the given Colour.

      • turnComplete

        public int turnComplete()
        Accessor method to return the state of turn completion
        Returns:
        An integer turnComplete denoting the status of the current turn (0-2)

      • resetTurn

        public void resetTurn()

      • continueTurn

        public void continueTurn()

      • endTurn

        public void endTurn()

      • movePiece

        public void movePiece(Player player,
             Move aMove)
        Moves a piece that is on one square of the board to another square of the board, positions given by Location objects. Will also remove any pieces if applicable.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player who owns the piece to be moved.
        start - A Location object containing the information of the starting square.
        end - A Location object containing information on the square to move the piece to.

      • deltaX

        public int deltaX(Location start,
         Location end)

      • deltaY

        public int deltaY(Location start,
         Location end)

      • printArray

        public void printArray()
        Prints the array to the screen. Used instead of a toString() method to identify what information is being held in the board.
